msContents.summary: Fragment from a will of Nilion that mentions some land and a house

msItem.note: Written across the fibers; the back is blank; only the top margin is intact
14 lines of writing by a small round hand
Four variant restorations of the emperor's name are possible
A small detached piece cannot be placed

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University at Akhmim through H.I. Bell in December 3 1926; no. 109 in Bell's inventory
